html:
fat ones leanness. Fatness represents temporal prosperity, goodness, and earthly blessings (Gen. 45:18; Deut. 31:20; Neh. 9:25; Prov. 13:4) leanness represents a lack of temporal or spiritual prosperity and earthly blessings and is caused by wickedness and slothfulness (17:4-5; Gen. 41:2-20). Thus in the passage cited above, the Lord replaces the world's fatness with leanness.

his glory. The expressions his thorns, his briers, his forest, and his fruitful field (10:16-19) refer to the king of Assyria in all his glory.
